items.sentence: How do I know that you aren't just telling me what I want to hear?

Tom was able to buy a gun, but he couldn't buy any bullets for it.

The ticket you've bought isn't valid for travel during peak times.
Tom spent all the money he had to buy a birthday present for Mary.

Tom says that he always has at least three hundred dollars on him.
I hope that you know that the last thing I want to do is hurt you.
I hope you know that the last thing that I want to do is hurt you.

Tom works as a blood spatter analyst with the metropolitan police.
Tom won't back down from any fight, no matter who he's up against.
Tom's new puppy is so small he can fit into the palm of your hand.

I suspect that Tom and Mary want us to help them do that tomorrow.

I suspect that Tom and Mary are the ones who told John about that.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was the last one to do that.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary might be tempted to do that.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary didn't want to go to Boston.

Tom told me he was going to the hospital to visit his grandmother.
Tom hopes that Mary knows she has do what John has told her to do.
I'm almost certain Tom will get into the university of his choice.

I don't think you need to tell Tom why you weren't here on Monday.
